content:
Posted: December 3, 2015
												This is a zombies review.I will review each map separately and then review all of them as one.Kino Der Toten 7.5/10-----------------------This map is quite easy but a very classical map with one of the best training spots at the stage not a very hard map due to dog rounds and the most overpowered Wonderweapon the ThunderGun. Overall a enjoyable map which is good for new players to learn how to train and sustain points with interesting art.Five 6/10----------This map is extremely hard. Due to there only being one training spot in this map which is expensive to get to and to make it work well you need to buy 2 doors or so. The boss is also painful to deal with as he can take away your gun but if you kill it you receive a Bonfire sale. The Winter's Howl is a bad Wonderweapon which effects the map. Overall the map is good with friends due to a fun camping spot in the elevators but solo it is hard to get to high rounds due to there only being one training spot.Ascension 8/10----------------This map is pretty sick. With the first kind of new way to receive pack a punch launching the three flight pads. The map was pretty easy due to the fact that you could train anywhere pretty well and having the Thunder gun, though it had hard elements of it such as the monkeys forcing you if playing solo to only really having 2 perks or so cause they would just steal them. Overall a great map to get extremely high rounds and enjoyable with friends.Call of the dead 7/10----------------------Ok call of the dead is very different to all maps. It starts off having fog which is a pain and dealing with the boss of the map George. This fellow gets in your way and if you attack him or are attacked by him he gains enrage and runs super fast and attacks you but calm-able by taking him to the water. The Wonderweapons are great the Scavenger is a great explosive weapon but PHD is needed or becomes useless and will kill you. The VR-11 Is good to take out George but making him calm and turns a zombie into a human like a moving monkey bomb. The map is good with a decent training spot and enjoyable oh though has annoying features like George and how far jug and the power is from spawn. Overall a good map and worth playing.Shangri-La 4/10-----------------Ok ok this map is a very hard and badly made map. Due to it being so close quartered there is no real good training spots but the fact you have the Baby maker does make it some how survival-able cause its a great weapon. The map itself looks amazing with cool looking textures and a amazing atmosphere with it being all tropical. Overall the fact the map brought cool new stuff like the water and new zombies it makes it enjoyable but it is unlikely to get to a high round on.Moon 3.5/10--------------Moon is one of those maps you really enjoy or dislike. For me its dislike I love the theme of the moon but the fact low gravity really does mess with you as you can bounce back into your train is annoying as hell. This map has a sick Easter egg blowing up the earth and empowering the Aether to Richthofen. The map has a nice feel to it but is annoying spawning on earth then going to the moon and how you have to do this 2 times to get jug unless your a skilled player. A map for people that are better at zombies but still pretty bad due to it being annoying hard to get basics.In the end buying black ops one is a good idea but do buy with all the maps. Its much harder then black ops 2 due to maps just being made worse and harder mainly cause training in most of these maps can be quite a challenge. Overall the game is 36/60 which is worth a buy.

content:
Posted: June 9, 2015
Took me 2 playthroughs and a video guide to understand completely what was going on ;_;Pros- The game was fun- Had a great well thought out and complex story that also closed some things from the previous title COD 5: WAW- Plot Twists and conspiracy were a nice change to see in the series- Likeable characters such as Woods and Reznov- Great gun and grenade sounds, you really feel the Impact of a grenade going off- Veteran was a real trial and I got stuck on many parts and rage quit :D- Zombies with more perks and great locations like the moon with zero gravity- Multi was fun and didn't feel to fast paced compared to the newer titlesCons- Wager Matches are completely dead so to get the achievement "In the Money" you need help from the community-  Killstreak rewards didn't feel to... well, rewarding8.8/10 - Most In-depth story I've played in a COD game to date, Great Zombie modes and enjoyable but forgettable Multiplayer

												cod black ops is one of my most favourite cods ever. its because of the junglewarfare, the cool weapons from the time of vietnam-war and stuff. the gameplay is ok, i mean come on. its the same ♥♥♥♥in gameplay since cod4, but they added some new stuff in black ops which i realy like. the dolfin diving, the wager matches, the hilarious over-the-top-funny gunsounds..... oh and the zombiemode returns.  the graphics are old, end of story. they never were something that could be used as a selling-point in black ops. and i admit that they should have done better in this terms, but graphics are not everything. i like the gore-effects in singleplayer and zombies, which you only find in tray-arch cods, i like the maps very much, which offer alot of variety if you are a fan of snow, jungle, and cuban towns. i dont know exactly what makes black ops so special for me. i spent more than 200 hours on the ps3-version of this, got all prestige-lvls and im still playing it like mad. i mean ofcourse its not ok that a game from 2010 still costs 40 bucks and maybe even more, but if you see it for less somewhere else, get your hands on it. its defintely worth even if you borrow a console-version from a friend

												I am currently replaying the Black Ops series in order to refresh my memory for the BOIII SP. I generally really enjoy the CoD SPs because they are really fun B Action movies. They aren't going to win an Oscar but they are a short, fun shooting gallaries. That being said BO1 stands out amoug them all up to ghosts(Never played AW SP yet). I highly recommend still picking this game up just for the SP. It's about 6 hours long.

												cod black ops is one of my most favourite cods ever. its because of the junglewarfare, the cool weapons from the time of vietnam-war and stuff. the gameplay is ok, i mean come on. its the same ♥♥♥♥in gameplay since cod4, but they added some new stuff in black ops which i realy like. the dolfin diving, the wager matches, the hilarious over-the-top-funny gunsounds..... oh and the zombiemode returns.  the graphics are old, end of story. they never were something that could be used as a selling-point in black ops. and i admit that they should have done better in this terms, but graphics are not everything. i like the gore-effects in singleplayer and zombies, which you only find in tray-arch cods, i like the maps very much, which offer alot of variety if you are a fan of snow, jungle, and cuban towns. i dont know exactly what makes black ops so special for me. i spent more than 200 hours on the ps3-version of this, got all prestige-lvls and im still playing it like mad. i mean ofcourse its not ok that a game from 2010 still costs 40 bucks and maybe even more, but if you see it for less somewhere else, get your hands on it. its defintely worth even if you borrow a console-version from a friend

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
												I think this is one of the better Call of Duty games. Probably my favourite next to Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare. Sucks that this game doesn't go on sale often, but I definitely got my money's worth when I bought it at around $50 CAD. (~450 hours in multiplayer and ~110 in campaign/zombies, all DLC owned.)First the campaign mode. I think it's a really unique campaign set in a really interesting time period. Like most of the Call of Duty games, the gameplay is very linear and repetitive, and ramping up the difficulty only results in a mindless, unfair ♥♥♥♥♥how of trying to stay alive. Putting the gameplay aside however, I found the story to be really good. There were some great cinematic moments in the campaign, a really neat plot twist, some great locations and overall solid story. The zombies mode is pretty fun. Even though I mostly played it to get the achievements, it was still fun to play the maps on solo. I do find the two-hit-to-down system kind of unfair though; it really♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me off in a lot of moments when i didn't have Juggernaut, or a zombie just performs a double hit. But overall, the maps the base game come with are fun. The multiplayer is great. Fantastic maps, actual dedicated servers (meaning, community servers with a server list), great weapon balance and variety (though shotgun and sniper selection is pretty meagre) and mod tools. Occasionally, there are performance issues, but most of these were at launch and have been dealt with. It was the first Call of Duty to include customization of it's kind (with emblems, face paint etc.) and theatre mode which is awesome. There is still a very active and healthy population too.Overall, I'd give this game a flat 8.0/10. It's a great package; solid campaign, fantastic multiplayer and fun zombies mode. In terms of DLC, I guess I would recommend buying them if you are really into zombies and multiplayer as all of the DLC maps for multiplayer were really well done, and the same goes for the zombies maps. They are pricey, so I would get them on sale. I'd probably give each a 7.0/10.

content:
Posted: September 28, 2015
												Old Gold. The most solid COD title to ever be on PC, despite the poor aging and un-competitive framerate. The story&campaign is also very well made, and surely will throw anyone off and give them a really awesome experience for what they are getting themselves into. Which by the way make almost every other campaign related to COD out there seem obsolete compared.9/10 - Mainly because campaign games never really perform super well either way.Finisher note: The COD franchise is pretty much dried up after MW3, coming from someone that has even cared to play the COD:AW one. But with a base line at 60 FPS, games like CS:GO give me what i deserve as a consumer more so than their 45-60 fps lameness. 200-300fps is where it is at on PC with CS nowdays, even though this unique blend sure has had it's good moments trough time.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 10, 2015
												Simply put, this is one of the best Call of Duty games of all time. Period. I am really blown away by how great this game is. I have always been more of a fan of the CoD games set in Modern times, but this one is in the Cold War. On top of that, there are TONS of negative reveiws about the stutter. So naturally, my expextations were pretty low, but that all changed when I played it.First off, I am playing on a midrange laptop, and while it's not as powerful as I would like, it's still a nice little gaming machine. Even with my less-than-impressive computer, this game, which was said to have a stutter even on people's big custom "console killers", ran at a steady 35-40 fps with no stutter or lag of any kind, with everything all the way up except anti-aliasing (I always turn it off because it's such a fps killer).The Campaign is the best I've played, with a complex story that jumps around through time and plot twists that surprised the hack out of me. Nothing is repetitive, and everything you do really feels like it matters in the story and is't a filler. As an added bonus for Waw fans, two characters return (YAY!) The multiplayer is also very, very fun.About the price: As good as it is, it's a five year old game that is not worth 40 dollars. I recomend getting it on Amazon, because it's only 20 dollars there. Saving 20 dollars was worth the wait. Also, don't get it used, because the code will already be used and you won't be able to play it. The verdict: This is a great game that you really should get. Buy it new on Amazon for 20 dollars, get it in the mail, take off the plastic rap, shove that disc into your computer, dowload it, and then play like there's no tomorrow.

content:
Posted: March 20, 2016
												This game is good in many ways, but has a couple problems. I still enjoy the !@$% out of it though.Controls (7/10)The Controls are not the greatest in the world. for example, you might accidently throw a grenade or a smoke and that can kill you, and in zombies, V is not the best for knife. I would recommend to use a Xbox Controller when playing this game.Gameplay (7.5/10)Even though I love zombies and maybe even multiplayer a little bit, but it gets very repetitive. Campaign is good, multiplayer is not popular and zombies are great, So don't expect the best.Graphics (9.5/10)Its great for Its time and still is today, the maps are highly detailed and explosions and other effects are good tooReplay Value (8/10)Zombies, Multiplayer, Campaign oh my! Like I said, all gamemodes are not the best, but you might like it!SummaryOverall, some parts of this game is not great and the controls aren't that good, but there is a lot of greatness in this game, and there is certain mods for multiplayer or zombies, so go pick this game up in a sale, because 40 bucks is too high for this game. 8/10

The other review I did was false, and I apologize for that, I was younger than I was now, but now I know what a "review" is. The zombies is great in this game, I think it was nice to see a return of zombies. The multiplayer is great, all the variety of mods you can use is just incredible. There's one of the mods that allows you to actually play survival in Black Ops. The campaign I haven't actually played much of. I haven't actually got all the DLC for this game, and I don't know why. This game is a great game for slaying zombies, killing humans and... yeah just killing humans. If you like shooting people online, then buy this game. If you like slaying zombies, also buy this game.

												В Call of Duty: Black Ops присутствует масштабная однопользовательская кампания. Сюжет игры позволит вжиться в роль бойца специального подразделения, которого будут регулярно отправлять в различные горячие точки нашей планеты.  В арсенале главного героя окажется не только привычное оружие, но и баллистические ножи, пиротехнические патроны для дробовика, арбалет с разрывными боеприпасами и другое. Мультиплеер может порадовать различными режимами, например, «Захват флага», «Бомба», «Командный бой» и другими. Моя оценка 7/10.

content:
Posted: March 23, 2012
												Best Call of Duty game to date -- Much better than any of the Modern Warfare games. The storyline may be over the top, but it was extremely well written and much more engaging than previous installments. The multiplayer is extremely balanced and "CoD points" are a welcome addition - You choose exactly what you want to unlock with the points that you earn from completing games and challenges. Even though Black Ops was released in 2010, it's the ONLY CoD game (aside from 4) that has had me playing it for more than a few months. I know I'll be playing this game until the release of its sequel: Iron Wolf.9/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 5
Dragovich, Kravchenko, Steiner... these "men" must die.Call Of Duty Black Ops is one of my favorite Call Of Duty games in the series. While most people would prefer something like Call Of Duty 4 or Modern Warfare 2 mine is always going to Black Ops 1.Taking place in the 1960's during the Cold War and wars like the Vietnam War. The game is portrayed from the point of view of Alex Mason. A CIA Agent who was brainwashed by the Soviets to translate the numbers prior to the Soviet invasion of the United States Of America.I won't be getting too much into the details of the missions because i know that there are still some people who have not played this game. But the missions in this game are fantastic. Super enjoyable and set around different locations of the world. Some of the locations include area's such as Cuba during the Bays Of Pig Invasion. Or Vorkuta. A Soviet labor camp where you start an uprising. Or even during the Vietnam War with iconic battles like the Battle of Khe Sanh. This game has some of the best level design and they are super enjoyable. I finished the game on Veteran and while some of the area's in the game were pure ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t it was really fun taking things slowly and leaning out to do suppressive fire and then moving up. Crawling through the trenches of Vietnam or taking cover inside Castro's compound.The multiplayer in this game is still pretty active i didn't play much of it since i played more Combat Training as im no longer used to the multiplayer portion of Call Of Duty since i play more Battlefield and other games with more open maps and bigger maps. Apart from that i wouldn't mind playing it from to time but it's not anymore the thing that i used to love playing when i used to bang this game on the Xbox 360.The Zombies is one of the best mode's to play with friends super fun and addicting. But problem being is that if you don't have mods then there is only 2 maps for you to play on. They are Ok but nothing too impressive. If you can then buy the DLC although i suggest you to not do it as it is rarther expensive and you only get 4 multiplayer maps and one zombie map. Zombies can be fun with friends but by yourself. Ehhh it can get boring.I played this game back on the Xbox 360 that i have so many hours. Probably around 400 or 500 something. On the PC here i have around 48 hours. I put a ton of time into this game in my life and i still love it. One of the best singleplayer stories and some of the most enjoyable multiplayer and zombies mode. If you are looking for a great game set during the 1960's Cold War then pick this up when it's on sale. You will love it and will most likely put a ton of hours into this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2015
												I bought this game because of the nostalgia of the Multiplayer and the Zombies. I did played the missions back when I used to have it for PlayStation but I don't really like replaying missions. When the game installed I jumped into it and the first thing I did went untoward zombies. The zombies was really good I played for about 20 - 30 minutes with an online group and we eventually lost. After that I decided to go the multiplayer section. Since it was my first time plain this game in a PC I wasn't used to looking for servers manually rather than the PlayStation or Xbox automatically putting me in one. From here is what it was a bit disappointing because There was no servers with normal team dead match , ctf, search and destroy, but rather 5 servers at most with 20+ people in each. And yet in those servers the game modes are not like the original.Once you go into the server it automatically downloads the mod needed to play the game. And it's infected with skins of zombies on top. I mean it's boring and nothing like he original. They're constantly trying to sell you something and you can't even leave in the middle of the game or else you get banned. That's one of the servers another is like a big survival  were you play agains bots with other players , I found that one to be the "best" one out of the bunch. The ones where normal like Tdm or ctf where very strict I mean like people taking the game to seriously. My own teammates where killing and the respawn time was like 25 secs so it was annoying. I got annoyed and killed one of the and I got banned. Maybe I got the wrong class or something but how the hell was I supposed to know. It said team death match So I joined but it turned out to be a strict boring server. Other lobbies/servers weren't any better. I think this game is great and is one of the best Call of Duties , but I think the reason why this game does better in multiplayer in consoles is because there's no custom servers with very strict rules. It's shouldn't be a hustle just to play team death match or Capture the flag.Also 40 bucks it's a bit much. I was able to get it for 20  because of the steam sale but either way.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
												After all the years I've played this game, I thought I'd finally review it. The other review I did was false, and I apologize for that, I was younger than I was now, but now I know what a "review" is. The zombies is great in this game, I think it was nice to see a return of zombies. The multiplayer is great, all the variety of mods you can use is just incredible. There's one of the mods that allows you to actually play survival in Black Ops. The campaign I haven't actually played much of. I haven't actually got all the DLC for this game, and I don't know why. This game is a great game for slaying zombies, killing humans and... yeah just killing humans. If you like shooting people online, then buy this game. If you like slaying zombies, also buy this game.

content:
Posted: November 21, 2010
												Call of Duty: Black Ops takes the successes of Modern Warfare 2 and tweaks them to be a much better-rounded multiplayer game. Progression and kits still exist, with an extra level of the metagame surrounding getting paid in "CoD Points".  Weapons, unlike in Modern Warfare 2 are far more balanced overall, anti-cheat is strong with the dynamic duo of VAC-and-Admin, and dedicated servers return. Infinity Ward may have stumbled when taking care of it's PC playerbase, but Treyarch hasn't and has actually surpassed Infinity Ward's ability to develop for the PC platform.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 13, 2011
												I liked the style in this game more than I liked the style in World At War. Less grey. Both are good games though but I did like this one better. It's over-the-top action with a good story, cool co-op zombie mode and fun multiplayer (way better than WaW since there are no vehicles). But it did feel different after all those hours playing Modern Warfare 2. I kinda expected the controls to feel the same, but they didn't (somehow it felt sluggish). But you'll adjust soon enough. Anyhow, the multiplayer will keep you entertained for months.[Rating: 92/100]

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 14, 2016
												Campaign:-A rather intelligent and psychological story, with some twists.-Gameplay, although varied, is not particularly memorable-Several small sections were very frustrating as you would die over and over again-Action is quite over the top and unrealistic, and characters are thinZombies:-Solo zombies is a fun way to spend a few hours.-Practically no one to play Co-Op zombies with, though, which is a shame, as zombies would be much more enjoyable if you were playing with someone else.Multiplayer:-Perhaps the best part of the game, would definitely be if this game were much more popular.-I enjoyed it a lot at first, but soon got bored.-Good weapons, class and points system.-Rather easy to get into, doesn't take a lot of practice, unless you're new to shooters.-Only a few Australian servers, only one or two of which are popular. This makes it rather repetitive, playing Nuketown TDM over and over again.-Not very varied with modes on Australian servers (would be much more varied if you lived in a place where there were many popular servers and modes)Verdict: 7.5/10, worth buying at around 60-65% off ($10-$15)Campaign is good but doesn't really beg for a replay, zombies is something you might play occasionally on Solo, and multiplayer is great, but would be much better if there were more popular servers and modes, and hence, more variation.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 4, 2016
												Note:I am not including negatives because they are so minorShort:It's a CoD game,they are all awesome and addicting.Long:Call of Duty Black Ops is probably the best CoD game Ive played out of all of the franchise.CAMPAIGN MODE:Let us begin with the campaign.The game takes place after World at War and is set in the cold war (1960-70) and you are Captain Alex Mason.While you are playing the events of his war experience,the story is greater as you are being interrogated by an old CIA handler of yours who is trying to get answers to stop the nova 6 attacks.It is crafted in a way that combines kick♥♥♥♥♥pure war action with a gripping set of characters and story which maintains itself in Black ops 2 and 3.MULTIPLAYER:Not really as big as it is nowadays,but it still delivers a fun experience to keep you occupied after campaign along with the bonus mode.It allows you to play a variety of game modes (in fairness some people don't play the objective) which gives you XP.Levelling up unlocks new weapons,attachtments,perks,equipment and personalization items.There is a fairly large amount of tactics you can use,wether it be quickscoping to knifing you can always find atleast 1 way to have fun.And don't worry,it gets better when you play the wager modes or team up with friends to dominate the other team.NAZI ZOMBIES:The famous bonus mode of treyarch games,nazi zombies is a fan favourite and an epic carnage to clear the gaps in the awesome storyline.In this mode you can team up with 3 other players/friends or solo to fight off endless waves of the undead,often being Nazis.As you gain points,you can access new areas,purchase badass guns,colas for perks and eventually reach pack a punch to upgrade your gun into a laser shooting super weapon.You can also explore the map to find clues to the eerie storyline or find the map objects that play epic songs to fight zombies to.The characters for each map are also epic,from crazed nazi scientists,to John kennedy to Fidel castro to Robert englund.How long can you survive?OVERALL:Honestly the best CoD game ever and another epic installment to the franchise.However if you have access,it would definetly say it is better to play on console (incoming PC master race weebs).

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 12, 2011
												IMO this is the last great COD game from a multiplayer perspective, considering the recent incarnations of the series have been somewhat disappointing in terms of the multiplayer.This game has ranked dedicated MP servers available for rent. That is what us PC players want. Not matchmaking, why won't you learn this lesson Acti/Treyarch/IW?The single player for this game has all the usual hallmarks of a Call of Duty storyline, however the story has a few plot-holes but if you aren't over-analysing the story too much, you will find it a pleasant experience.The multiplayer is really where it is at, fast paced and exciting. However there are some issues with the netcode and it isn't quite as polished from that perspective. The ability to control spectator auto-kick functionality on the servers would have been useful, however Treyarch have decided to limit all those capabilities on the ranked servers - a terrible idea.If you are looking for a great server to play on - Check out the below group for the NORULES server details.http://steamcommunity.com/groups/norulescrew

I'm not too sure I was young when I played this bull♥♥♥♥♥♥before.If you want to get the game for Zombies, like I did, then don't bother. Go get World at War instead. Much more content and decent mods (Not just aim hacking). Not to mention I got put with someone from the US when playing, this ment my ping... wasn't the best. Not to mention my internet isn't the fastest thing ever. Really spoils the fun.If you want to go back to the game and play it for a few hours to have some fun then go ahead and buy it. But don't expect to play it for very long.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
												I'm not even a fan of the franchise and I thought this was an amazing game.The main story was the stroke of a genius. Awesome plot twists and a satisfying ending that didn't leave me suicidally depressed. 10/10The controls and interface were simple and easy to acquaint myself with, and the gamepaly was fun, fast-paced and energetic- like I expected. Some parts of the game felt like a cool action movie. 8/10The game is several years old and the graphics are still pretty good. It's also not a very demanding game, so a lower-middle end PC should be able to max out the settings. 7/10Haven't played multiplayer. PvP isn't really my thing. NA/10Lastly, zombie survival mode. 'nuff said. 8/10Overall, 8.25/10

content:
Posted: December 1, 2016
												Probably the only COD review I'll ever write. Not groundbreaking, but definitely an original and intriguing campaign with a solid multiplayer mode.+ Great settings/environments, AAA voice acting (Gary Oldman, Ed Harris, Ice Cube, Sam Worthington), fantastic color palette and lighting effects. Sound design and music is great. Lots of fun with a story that'll surprise you for a COD campaign.- OK textures, weird aliasing, random crashes, not a ton of weapons considering the era, flat antagonists.8/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 21, 2010
												Call of Duty: Black Ops takes the successes of Modern Warfare 2 and tweaks them to be a much better-rounded multiplayer game. Progression and kits still exist, with an extra level of the metagame surrounding getting paid in "CoD Points".  Weapons, unlike in Modern Warfare 2 are far more balanced overall, anti-cheat is strong with the dynamic duo of VAC-and-Admin, and dedicated servers return. Infinity Ward may have stumbled when taking care of it's PC playerbase, but Treyarch hasn't and has actually surpassed Infinity Ward's ability to develop for the PC platform.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 13, 2011
												I liked the style in this game more than I liked the style in World At War. Less grey. Both are good games though but I did like this one better. It's over-the-top action with a good story, cool co-op zombie mode and fun multiplayer (way better than WaW since there are no vehicles). But it did feel different after all those hours playing Modern Warfare 2. I kinda expected the controls to feel the same, but they didn't (somehow it felt sluggish). But you'll adjust soon enough. Anyhow, the multiplayer will keep you entertained for months.[Rating: 92/100]

content:
Posted: June 19, 2016
												R.I.P. Call of Duty, This is the last good game in the series. Black Ops 2 was Eh. Black Ops 3 is bad. Advanced Warfare IsGarbage. Ghosts made me want to kill myself. Pros:-Zombies-Multiplayer servers are still up and active-Quality Gameplay-Ok story-Graphics have held up for 6 years-Weapon Customization isn't limited by how many 'tokens' you had, like in black ops 2.-Controller Support-Multiplayer servers doesnt seem to have dlc maps (which is good if you are like me and dont own any dlc)-Active communityCons:-Only 2 zombie maps (not including the arcade topdown shooter) in the vanilla game.-Some servers have really dumb rules. (Such rules as *CROUCH* which means you have to be crouched and cant run, unless under direct fire.)-Game costs $40 dollars when its 6 years old.

												It's the last part of COD which I've been playing in, so basing on my experience I can say that the first Black Ops is very good game, where you don't fight in space and can't do double jumps etc, so it makes it more realistic. Surely I would reccomend this game even if it's almost 7 years now.

There are no more dedicated servers so multiplayer isn't as great as it once was. This game is worth buying for the zombies game mode.

content:
Posted: June 14, 2016
												Campaign:-A rather intelligent and psychological story, with some twists.-Gameplay, although varied, is not particularly memorable-Several small sections were very frustrating as you would die over and over again-Action is quite over the top and unrealistic, and characters are thinZombies:-Solo zombies is a fun way to spend a few hours.-Practically no one to play Co-Op zombies with, though, which is a shame, as zombies would be much more enjoyable if you were playing with someone else.Multiplayer:-Perhaps the best part of the game, would definitely be if this game were much more popular.-I enjoyed it a lot at first, but soon got bored.-Good weapons, class and points system.-Rather easy to get into, doesn't take a lot of practice, unless you're new to shooters.-Only a few Australian servers, only one or two of which are popular. This makes it rather repetitive, playing Nuketown TDM over and over again.-Not very varied with modes on Australian servers (would be much more varied if you lived in a place where there were many popular servers and modes)Verdict: 7.5/10, worth buying at around 60-65% off ($10-$15)Campaign is good but doesn't really beg for a replay, zombies is something you might play occasionally on Solo, and multiplayer is great, but would be much better if there were more popular servers and modes, and hence, more variation.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 24
												One of the last decent games of the franchise Call of Duty®: Black Ops is nothing more than the linear shooter you've come to expect from the genre and series.It doesn't revolutionize anything gameplay wise so you might be thinking why is this any different than any of the other CoD games I've played? Well its main selling point for me was the very riveting storyline and narrative the game has to offer. This is in my opinion the epitome of good stories featured in the CoD series.The game will take you across several years of its timeline, featuring the war in Vietman, to the Cuban Missile crisis and even some late WW2 elements. The characters are there, over the top as you'd expect, with dialogue and voice acting fresh out of your American summer blockbuster (if you're a sucker for those look no further for your needs) but in truth it is really quite fitting and fun for the spirit of the game. There's twists and turns in the story as your delve deep into the depravity of war and the mind of the main character Mason, a CIA special operations agent who served during the Cold War . There's a lot to be said about the twist of the story, some might call it cheap and predictable but for me back when I played in 2010, I was pleasantly surprised and satisfied.There's a nice atmosphere in the game overall and the transition between the different playable arcs and environments is excellently done.Gameplay wise... well it's Call of Duty. It's as linear as it gets, it's aim down the sights until enemies die, it's the awkward vehicular combat (if you've played any of the battlefield series you know what I'm talking about), it's the 'shooting gallery' from a minigun/machine gun, it's the weird gadgets you'll use for a mission and then never see again. It's nothing new, it's nothing challenging but it's fun for a couple of hours. There's plenty of guns to use (side note, the sound design is pretty mediocre for most of the weapons) and there's plenty of enemies to kill and the level design is adequately done and some of the environments are part of a less explored theme in the FPS genre. I know it's a 7 year old game but if you're a die hard fan of the CoD series like I am, you'd be remiss if you somehow haven't experienced Black Ops. Furthermore the game features a killer soundtrack and it is guaranteed to keep your blood pumping through the action sequences. Before the downfall of the series began, before the over-saturation of the franchise, Black Ops stands like a beacon on how good Call of Duty used to be. These days might be long gone, but it's always nice to return to this after many years and see if it actually holds up to other titles. Naturally as years pass by this will steadily become less relevant but for a 7 year old game, it's actually not terrible visually wise. A great addition for your Call of Duty collection.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 20, 2014
												One of the best Call of Duty games out there! It has an amazing campaign, great multiplayer, and amazing zombie maps! Honestly I would have to say this: DON'T BUY THE DLC UNLESS YOU'RE INTO ZOMBIES! Don't get me wrong the Multiplayer maps are greta in this game. The entire game runs of dedicated servers for Multiplayer and most if not all the DLC servers run off the official Treyarch servers. So why is this a bad thing? NO ONE PLAYS ON THE TREYARCH SERVERS! It's sad really. If you're really that interested in playing the Multiplayer DLC maps then get it on console. Anyway, another problem with this game is that dedicated servers have a lot of stupid rules, a lot of Nuketown 24/7 servers, and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ admins for the most part. Another big problem is that not a lot of people play the Wager Matches (Gun Game, Sharpshooter, etc). In general it's pretty hard to find a match of Multiplayer due to the fact not a lot of people actually play the PC version of Black Ops anymore. Which is a shame considering this is one of my favorite COD games! Anyway enough of me talking negative, let's talk about all the postitives! For one thing, these have amazing and memoriable maps! They're pretty basic due to the fact the entire game is set around the cold war. Some maps you may recognize such as Launch, Nuketown, Firing Range, and Stadium. The guns feel great and are fun to use! And just about every server is a Ground War server so it makes it even more fun! The more people the better right? If I'm not mistaken, this is the first COD game to introduce controller support for the PC. I know. I know. Call of Duty: World at War had controller support by typing in console commands, (Honestly I'm not sure about Call of Duty: 4 Modern Warfare due to the fact I don't have the game as of making this review) but it wasn't as easy as Black Ops. Black Ops gives you the controller options right at the options menu easy as that. Sadly, if you played this game for a long time on console (not me) there is not auto-aim assist what so ever. It's easier to use the Keyboard anyway so whatever. One last thing I have to say is that this is the last Call of Duty game to allow mods. The mods are really fun in this game! There's a mod called Zombie Annihilation mod to pretty much you can play Infected in Black Ops, A reverse and Hardcore Gun Game, and many more! The mods are only for Multiplayer however and not for Zombies, but it's still fun to mess around with!Overall this game gets a 9/10. I highly recommend it!

												Before I rate anything about this game, I'd like to adress an annoying graphics issue. There are no performance problems on my PC, and there better not be. But anyway, I noticed there is a lighting glitch with the graphics. There is a mission where you're in a cave tunnel with an ally with flashlight. And your flashlight casts light on everything like surfaces, etc. but not on any people or anything. They are literally a shadow when you shine your light on them. You can't see a single thing on them or identify who they are unless you recognize their voice. This made the game very difficult to tell what's what. I got this game on CD for much cheaper than what steam is selling it for which is currently $40. That's a crap deal by the way. This game is truly only worth more like $15 at the most.Other than that awkward glitch with the lighting, the rest of the game looks pretty normal, and the campaign wasn't the best, again part of it being that annoying graphical issue. but zombies is where it's at though.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 5, 2014
												One, if not the, best part of the series. Very good campaign, great & entertaining multiplayer. The campaign can last up to 20 hours if you take your time, play at one of the elevated difficulty settings and try to go for all the hidden intel & achievements while you're at it. The story isn't bad, has many "well known" characters and incredible voice actors.Multiplayer has great variety. You can play your typical run&gun class just like a sneaky approach and be successful. Some maps are fairly large, others are almost tiny, but all of them are very well-made. Even with all the DLC, I'd say maybe one or two of the maps aren't among my favorites. They aren't bad, just not as good as the others. The rest of them is very good though and nicely detailled, almost as good as some of the old World at War maps.If you want a more-or-less current, highly-polished all around, part of the Call of Duty series, this should be the one to pick.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8
												The last decent Call of Duty. Still overpriced. Still selling the map packs for 10$ a pop. Activision is at best cheap and at worst  intentionally shady but all of that aside BLOPS 1 was a fun casual arcade shooter with cool guns,good MP maps, a really great zombies mode that hit it's peak in this title and possibly the best campaign in the series (THE NUMBERS MASON!). Graphically it's last gen but the art style is consistent and professionally done. It won't wow you but it passes. Having a reshade preset installed helps a lot if you have a nice pc and want to add some shine. Sadly it's years old now and it's seemingly impossible to get into a ranked multiplayer round but the game does have mod support and there are custom and modded lobbies to play in if you like that sort of thing.Grab it for the zombies or the campaign if you enjoy those modes but know what you're getting into with the MP and it being seemingly unsupported.

												Black ops, I had this game on my PS3 the bought it on the PC. Very fun shooter with decent maps, for the PC version alone, theres a server for everybody, regular no rules TDM/DOM, some weird modded server, or even a crouch tactical server. Zombies for black ops 1 was one of my favorites as well. The maps in zombies were open and had optional easter eggs to complete, had some good times on there but it can get a bit repetitive. Only advice I give you when going into this game is to watch out for the community, there's cool people, but the majority are out there to make you angry or sad or potentially make death threats... hehI guess that goes for anything on the internet :/8/10

content:
Posted: February 14
Call of Duty: Black OpsThe game with the best Campaign, Multiplayer and Zombies! On Steam the game costs 40€ but on 3rd party sites you can get this great game for just 10€!CampaignYou play as Alex Mason, part of the S.O.G on a mission to kill the cuban president.The gameplay is very smooth, all the 'maps' look great. They even made weapons that are only usable in the campaign. It has a lot of cool cutscenes and the story is actually really entertaining and action packed.MultiplayerThis is probably the reason you bought this game or you are one of the few people who bought it just for the campaign or zombies. Anyway, the multiplayer is really great. it has great maps and really cool weapons. Because this game is from 2010 and still 40€ the multipayer is bleeding to death. There are almost always 600 people online. So thats enough to enjoy this great shooter experience.ZombiesWith COD:BO you get 3 standard zombies maps: Kino der Toten, Five and Ded Ops Arcade. Ded Ops Arcade is just a top down shooter, can be enjoyable but its definitely not a great map. Five is in a military defense building where you play as four presidents. Then there is also this Jew-el called Kino der Toten, it takes place in an abandoned Naz¡ theater! This is the best map in my opinion. COD Zombies in just a 'kill until you get killed' mode. Endless waves of the undead!RATING 9/10 No need to bring up the numbers, we got enough already...

No clear aim of what to do next, yet you are on rails with your hand held along the way by your buddies. It's Duck Shoot with modern graphics. It's repetetive and boring. Gave up after a few missions. Wolfenstein The New Order did it so much better in every way!The Call of Duty franchise is SO overhyped. Won't be buying any more.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2010
												As a Call of Duty fan since the original back in 2003, I've seen the series go through its ups and downs. After the massive disappointment that was Modern Warfare 2, I was extremely skeptical on Black Ops. Good thing I was disappointed here too.The launch was extremely shaky on PC, but now that they've patched it a few times, the game works pretty well. What you'll find, should you choose to get it, is arguably the best Call of Duty campaign to date. It's dark. It's gritty. It's even disturbing. Most of all though, it delivers the trademark Call of Duty intensity whilst daring to be different. After you've gone through that, there's the return of Zombies mode (which I'm personally not a fan of) from World at War, and the deep multiplayer experience. In fact, Black Ops is the most well-balanced CoD game to date, wherein nothing is too over or underpowered and you have customization options like never before.Downside? It's the 7th CoD game. It's getting stale.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2016
												My advice? Play it on xbox or playstation. Don't bother with this version, it's horribly ported and has so many bugs and glitches that it's almost unplayable anymore.Leave it to Treyarch to lose interest in the toys that they make and let it break itself apart.This game is amazing in it's own right, the campaign is lively and very well written, the multiplayer is exceptionally fun, and the zombies always gives that fun you could never replace.However, with the more recent times, Treyarch stopped caring about this game. It was one of the better and more successful games in their franchise yet they still chose to let it die. The zombies mode literally doesn't work anymore, you'll be sitting there for a few hours before you find an actual online match, and the private match doesn't even work so you can't play zombies with your friends like the good ol' days. All you can do is force your friend to bring his entire rig over to your house so you could HOPE that the LAN works. THis has been a problem for what 2 years now? And Treyarch not only has said nothing about it, but continue to pump out garbage sequels instead of fixing the games that are actually good for their franchise.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 23, 2014
												Black Ops is one of the best Call of Duty's to hit the franchise. I think it is rather funny that Treyarch makes better Call of Duty titles than Infinity War. The story in this game is quite well done, with some exciting plot twists and great action/set peices. The mulitplayer is solid COD twitch shooting with some cool tack ons,  in addition to the great SIngleplayer and fun multiplayer the Zombies coop mode is also good fun with friends, in which up to 4 of your friends call fight endless waves of zombies with traps, and weapons its good stuff. The only downside is there are only 2 zombie maps for the standard game mode. The rest are 15 bucks a pop for the DLC map packs. Which is pretty insane how old the game is but Activision doesnt seem to like to price down their games even years after release. Hence why Call of Duty is 20 dollars... Anyway I highly recommend Black Ops to any franchise vet who has not played it or anyone looking for an enjoyable singleplayer with a solid multiplayer accompanyment.8.5/10

content:
Posted: December 14, 2013
												Black Ops, hmh. It's the game where everything started for me, I had actually just started gaming back then. Black Ops had already been out for more then 2 years back then. I joined a FFA Sniper Server and in the start, I really disliked it. So I decided to play CoD4, after 80 hours on Sniper Only servers in CoD4 (I brought BO and CoD4 at the same time on Steam), I decided to try Black Ops again, and thats when I fell in love with the game. As I said, sniping was all new to me and Black Ops is different from the rest of the CoD's. Generally the old CoD's has more style over them, making them more unique and exciting to play. I spent alot of time afk in the game when I just started, hoping that more "playtime" on Steam would gain me more respect, my first clan was sh*t, since the leader was a lying ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. I started my days out on the Rebel servers. When I just gained Prestige 15, lvl 27, I decided to try to join Aizen to see what kind of servers he was playing on when he didnt play on the Rebel HC SnD server. That's how my days in cK, eXo etc. started. I got into the softcore community on the SwMt server. I gained alot of new friends, people liked me and I loved the game. Theres alot of colours, especially compared to the other CoD's, they are bright and tempting. Black Ops has some bugs, bad hitreg unless you have a good PC + Net, lags, the reset bug wich made me lose 111000 kills, atleast I didnt lose my prestige and classes. But even thou Black Ops has some of these bugs, that really pisses you off and makes you angry, I still love it. The Black Ops community isnt the same to me anymore, alot of my friends quitted, plays rarely or moved on to another game. Theres alot of guys I dislike, theres alot of things I dislike about the game but I will always remember my golden days in Black Ops as the best in my gaming career.I might not play as much Black Ops as I used to, mainly because of my lags. I might play a bit more  again when I get my new PC working.But thanks to everyone in the Black Ops community for great laughs, games and fights. It's been awesome.6/6

number of helpful: 13 of 25 people (52%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 21, 2015
												The story... Geezus, the story of Black Ops is far beyond awesomeness. I mean the Modern Warfare trilogy is damn good at the story as well, the 3 games give a big whole, but I think I slightly like more this one. I play Call of Duties for the campaign mode, I'm barely interested in the multiplayer. No doubt, killin' each other in CoD's multiplayer is very entertaining and a great fun, but I buy CoD's for the story most of all. I'm more like a co-operative person. Yeah, there are co-op modes in the latest CoD's, I know and I like the Spec Ops', yet I think instead of this it would be greater if we could play the story mode co-operatively (like World at War). Well... the other thing, the Zombie Mode. No, I don't like it. It's terrible to me and damn boring. And I hate the pointless survival type of co-op (yet somehow I really enjoy MW3's survival, dunno why, but that's cool). I love killing zombies, but not in CoD's. One more little thing. I started this game not long ago for the first time (yeah, I was late about 5 years, but who gives a damn...) and I played it after MW3, which was the next CoD after Black Ops. The funny thing is that the BO has more beautiful graphics than MW3. :D It doesn't matter, it's just strange. The other technical stuffs, like controls, sound effects, music, voice acting, animations are pretty good - so the usual CoD quality.AND THERE'S A SCENE WHEREIN YOU FLY A CHOPPA AND SHOOT/BLOW UP LOTSA ENEMIES AND OTHER CHOPPAZ!!!! There's no word how much I love it. I love flying attack helicopters in general, so that part of the game was really sweet for me. Yeah, actually there are two scenes of it, but the second one is pretty short and altough it was fun, too, not that big hit like the first one. The only problem I got with it is the controls. I really could use an ascend/descend movement, but it went automatically and sadly it made the aiming impossible sometimes. Anyway, I recommend this game for the great, exciting, interesting and intense 60's cold war story, it's really worth the play.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2015
												Agrobal reviews yet another FPS :DThis is actually a Call of Duty that I like. This is a Call of Duty that I don't mind recommending. It seems Treyarch created a more engaging story. I was invested in the whole plot as predictable as it was. The writing is good for an action title and it doesn't ask more than mindless fun, which is exactly what it is. I enjoyed it for the most part but the only part I hated was how the plot twist was overhyped and explained over and over again. I can say for myself and a lot of players that it was predictable to begin with. Regardless, I am just surprised I liked this game. I still draw the line with zombies, just never was interested in the concept.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2014
												Well, there are lots of things to say about this game.1st. Black Ops Campaing was awesome, i was really sourprised.2nd. Multiplayer is great way to pass time with friends. (And also a good way of rage if you are bad like me)3rd. Zombie Mode. There are lots of things to say about this. Great maps, great to play either solo or Co-Op with friends or online. Really challenging, surviving endless waves of zombies until your hole crew dies, and you never get tired of it. You always want to get better at it! Zombie Mode is one of the only features i bought this game. Theres no need to pay for DLC's to have fun, you can buy them if you just want to have more maps to play with.4th. You are able to play against bots in multiplayer mode to practice.I totally recommend this game for everyone, youll enjoy it. I would just recommend to wait for sales, i dont really think its worth to buy it at $40.00

content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												I will not review the campaign, as I don't really remember it. Something about numbers. Who cares. I did, however, play a fair amount of Zombies with 2 friends. And it was a lot of fun. We killed tons of zombies. We sometimes struggled to efficiently co-operate, but put our differences aside and found our way to waves near 30-40. It was both satisfying in term of team work and shooting zombies. Pack a punch and perk drinks are ingredients that just make the mode tastier. Nonetheless, we missed a pause button because after 30 waves you often want to go to the head. Or to bed. Anyhow, it is a time consuming mode, where only little mistakes can cost you the round. But overall, most fun I had in Call of Duty Black Ops.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2016
												Black Ops is a fantastic game. I thoroughly enjoyed playing this upon it's release.Why am I leaving a negative review then? Well I purchased this on PC so that I could play through some of the Wager Matches that I used to love. Unfortunately, NO ONE'S PLAYING THEM! You can still play regular multiplayer and zombies, but no wager matches, leaving out a HUGE portion of what made Black Ops so enjoyable.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 24, 2016
												Честно говоря Black Ops - определённо не самая моя любимая часть этой серии. Мне не понравился не сюжет, не мультиплеер, не режим зомби. Если вы не фанат времен так называемой "Холодной войны" - то эта игра не для вас (я сейчас об экипировки и оружии в целом). Из плюсов:- Сюжет (да-да вот я тут обсираю сюжет и вдруг называю его плюсом)Сугубо фанатам он понравился, хотя я не нахожу его интересным.-ЗомбиСпустя 2 года Activision всё же его вернули. Думаю тогда для всех это было счастье - новые карты, оружие.Теперь о минусах:- DLCВ стандартные зомби карты вы наиграетесь как только дойтёте до улучшайзера. Что бы поиграть в самые топовые из них придётся купить парочку dlc. Также большая часть dlc содержит карты для мультиплеера, ктороые вообще мертвы. Т.е. игрокам не жалко 20$ на игру но жалко 10$ на дополнение.- Что простите?Call of Duty всегда была не самой реалистичной игрой, в который ГГ всегда захлёбывался в экшене. Кстати, СПОЙЛЕР. 1) Вы деретесь в тюрьме с каким-то бородатым мужиком (если я не ошибаюсь, то это 2-я миссия) и тут вы такие:- О Господи! Это что Резнов из WaW?! На момент действия World at War Резнову уже было по виду лет 40, либо Activision так представляют русских солдат. И тут на тебе - он, ни чуть не изменившись, пробывши около 10 лет в тюрьме стоит перед тобой.2) Русские придумали 6-ствольный пулемёт? Ммм, прикольно.3) ГГ что, ездит на мотоцикле и стреляет из дробовика как терминатор? Да это же пасхалка! Так всё 10/10.-Оружие Мне нравился Калашников MW2, MW3 и его верся в BO2. Но при его виде в MW и BO1 у меня начинались рвотные позывы.

												This "Review" is just on zombies...............(no multiplayer or campaign)Kino Der Toten: Pros-Great starting room (Awesome traning spot)Very noob friendlyCommunity favouriteThundergunThe stage115 soundtrackFirst map to have free teleportingCons-too damn overplayedthe squeakers downing with ray gunsthundergun ONLY gives 10 points per kill (10 POINTS!?)24 zombies take forever to get on the train (in the stage)The nova crawlersAscension:Pros-the pack a punch (fun challenge)the thundergun strateasy round 100gersh devicethe landerscons- the monkeys the pack a punch (its a pro/con depending on your skill)the rotating metal bar in spawn room Call of The Dead:Pros-Scavengerthe russian doll grenade (forgot the name)Cons-George romerofreezing waterpower locationShangri-La:Pros-baby gun......thats it..................?Cons- TOO DAMN HARD (the map is more against you)close quarters mapMoon: Pros-The Dual Zap Guns/WavegunQEDArea 51 (Free 2500~3500 points)The hackerthe PESThe wonderfull easter eggThe biodomeThe excavatorsEarth gets destroyedCons-The Excavators (Fun/Hard Challenge depending on your skill)Area 51 (Same as excavators)The Spaceman (Molesternaut)Not noob friendlyrandom jumps (You run then jump in the low gravity without will)The nova crawlers"Five":Pros- Bonfire sale................................thats it....Cons- Pentagon thiefClose quartersThe freeze gunpack a punch "Defcon" thing8/10 Would recommend to my brother-KKK

												C'est, lors de sa sortie, que j'ai du mettre la main au porte monnaie afin de m'acheter ce jeu. Fort de sa reprise en sérieux, cette épisode nous plonge dans des décors Vietnamiens somptieux comme terrain de jeu. C'est donc sur ces terres de mangeurs de pastèques que nous passeront le plus clair de notre temps et non dans les contré de la République Démocratique du Congo utilisé déjà dans le volet "Modern Warfare". Toutefois ce titre reste un peu court, mais rassurez vous, vous en aurez pour votre argent car il prend tout de même plus de temps qu'une balade en poney ou un vol en mongolfière.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 24, 2016
												Честно говоря Black Ops - определённо не самая моя любимая часть этой серии. Мне не понравился не сюжет, не мультиплеер, не режим зомби. Если вы не фанат времен так называемой "Холодной войны" - то эта игра не для вас (я сейчас об экипировки и оружии в целом). Из плюсов:- Сюжет (да-да вот я тут обсираю сюжет и вдруг называю его плюсом)Сугубо фанатам он понравился, хотя я не нахожу его интересным.-ЗомбиСпустя 2 года Activision всё же его вернули. Думаю тогда для всех это было счастье - новые карты, оружие.Теперь о минусах:- DLCВ стандартные зомби карты вы наиграетесь как только дойтёте до улучшайзера. Что бы поиграть в самые топовые из них придётся купить парочку dlc. Также большая часть dlc содержит карты для мультиплеера, ктороые вообще мертвы. Т.е. игрокам не жалко 20$ на игру но жалко 10$ на дополнение.- Что простите?Call of Duty всегда была не самой реалистичной игрой, в который ГГ всегда захлёбывался в экшене. Кстати, СПОЙЛЕР. 1) Вы деретесь в тюрьме с каким-то бородатым мужиком (если я не ошибаюсь, то это 2-я миссия) и тут вы такие:- О Господи! Это что Резнов из WaW?! На момент действия World at War Резнову уже было по виду лет 40, либо Activision так представляют русских солдат. И тут на тебе - он, ни чуть не изменившись, пробывши около 10 лет в тюрьме стоит перед тобой.2) Русские придумали 6-ствольный пулемёт? Ммм, прикольно.3) ГГ что, ездит на мотоцикле и стреляет из дробовика как терминатор? Да это же пасхалка! Так всё 10/10.-Оружие Мне нравился Калашников MW2, MW3 и его верся в BO2. Но при его виде в MW и BO1 у меня начинались рвотные позывы.

												I'll try to tell you the short version of the story.You are Mason, a US soldier tortured by your fellow CIA agent because you have knowledge about 'the numbers'. The numbers are codes for sleeper's agents, some kind of brainwashed soldier controlled mainly by three people, in this case your main target.Now, you are a sleeper's agent, but apparently you can't comprehend the numbers. This is later revealed because you were being sabotage.Okay. What I like from this game is, this game is the first CoD game that has a mission that allows you to control helicopter (a.k.a. Hind). Overall, this is that kind of CoD where you won't regret buying, buy when it's on Sale.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 18
CoD: BO is one of the few games I actually love. I have played it since 2012 and I'm coming back to this game ever since. I remember playing this game with friends all the time, especially when we all got the map packs, we played tons of hours on Moon, Der Riese and Ascension.. it was great. After that period, the new consoles were coming and I was migrating myself to the PC market, so I said goodbye to my love. I re-bought this game about a year after I built my PC, together with three map packs. At first, I was a little nervous, because at launch, the PC version didn't seem to be treated well, with many issues and optimalisation problems. However, after some time, the port actually became a bit better and it shows. I'm back with my love, and now that I have the time to play it (after a lot of personal issues), I'm really stoked and I already got some friends to play this with. I got some of my old friends to pick this back up and we're really enjoying it. The graphics are amazingly still up to par on most games, and because technology changes every second, it's really easy to run nowadays and it runs really well. So well, that still a large playerbase is playing this game on a daily basis and it's amazing to see other people joining the fun. You can still find matches online, and thanks to the addition of modded servers on multiplayer, it's still really refreshing. Zombies is really slick as well, people are still playing and it's still as fun as back in 2012. The story is great too, making this one of the best Call of Duty titles to come out and, in my opinion, it's still worth it to this day.The controls are rebindable, you can play with any Xbox 360 or XInput controller if you'd like to, but the keyboard/mouse combination is fine if you don't own a controller. + Graphics are still good, even up to this day;+ Fun story, really well executed, great narrative and quite realistic;+ Multiplayer is still alive and kicking (!);+ Zombies is still here too, and it's fun as heck to slay some zombies!+ Having the option to use an Xbox controller is amazing in my book;+ Great performance on modern machines;+ DLC is still being played, and especially with zombies, it's worth it!= Price is too high, 40€ is just too much, and especially if you'd want the expansions, it costs a fortune;= Mac version is a little weird, two completely different versions, with no way of playing together, so the Mac version is dead atm;= There is a bug where if you play on a modded server, your multiplayer rank may not be saved, so keep an eye out for that!Final score: 8/10It's a great title, and even it's age and some bugs cannot blow this, in my eyes, masterpiece, away!However, wait for a sale, otherwise you're just blowing money away for a 6 y/o-game :)If you have any questions or if you want to play some zombies, be not afraid to drop something in the comment section below or add me as your friend, I'm here to help! :)

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 10, 2015
												OYUN GENEL OLARAK; Oyun Soğuk Savaş döneminde geçmektedir. Oyuncu SOG adında gizli bir ekibin üyesidir. Bu ekip Laos, Küba, Vietnam gibi yerlerde varlık göstermektedir. Oyunda Call of Duty: World at War'dan Sgt. Reznov da yer almaktadır. Call of Duty oyunlarında klasikleşmiş araç kullanmada ise oyuncu bir SR-71 Blackbird ve Mil Mi-24 pilotu olacaktır. Çok oyunculu modda ise Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 ve Call of Duty: World at War'daki özellikler birleştirilmiştir. Oyuncular kendi silahlarını ve perklerini yaratabilmektedirler. Yeni "killstreak" olarak napalm füzesi ve uzaktan kumandalı bomba arabası açıklandı. Zombi modu oyunda bulunmakta fakat haritaları sadece veteran ve hardened versiyonlarındadır. Oyun ilk çıktığı gün sadece PlayStation 3 platformu için 1 milyondan fazla satmıştır. Zombi haritaları Call of Duty: World at War'dakilerden farklıdır. Treyarch Call of Duty: Black Ops için bir harita paketi duyurdu. İçinde 4 yeni çok oyunculu haritası ve 1 zombi haritası vardır. KARAKTERLER Yüzbaşı Alex Mason: Ana karakterimiz ve oyunun başrolündeki karakter. Call of Duty serilerinde aynı zamanda hem sesini duyabildiğimiz hem de yüzünü görebildiğimiz ilk oynanabilir karakter.Çavuş Frank Woods: Rütbe olarak Mason'dan daha düşük rütbede olsa da bize liderlik eden karakter. Kravchenko ile birlikte öldüğü düşünülse de serinin ikinci oyununda yaşadığı görülür. Mason'la aralarında komutan-asker ilişkisinden çok kardeşlik bağları vardır.Onbaşı Joseph Bowman: Yine Mason'dan daha aşağı rütbededir ancak ara sıra bize emirler verir. Tıpkı Woods gibi kardeşlik bağı vardır.Ajan Jason Hudson: Diğer bir oynanabilen karakter, Mason'un CIA'deki sağ kolu. Aslında Mason bu adamı çok sevmez. Üst düzey ve yetenekli bir CIA ajanı.Ajan Grigori Weaver: Rus asıllı bir CIA ajanı ve Hudson'ın en iyi arkadaşı. Kravchenko'nun gözüne telsiz antenini saplamasıyla sol gözü kör olmuştur.Yüzbaşı Viktor Reznov: Mason'un Vorkuta'da tanıştığı, II. Dünya Savaşı gazisi, eski Kızıl Ordu askeri. Vorkuta'dan kaçarken ölmüştür ancak birçok görevde karşımıza çıkar.Dr. Fredrich Steiner Nova gazını yaratan Nazi bilim adamı. Aynı zamanda Mason'ın beynini yıkamıştır. Mason tarafından infaz edilmiştir.Albay Lev Kravchenko Dragovich'in sağ kolu. Tıpkı Woods gibi öldüğü sanılır ancak serinin ikinci oyununda ortaya çıkar.General Nikita Dragovich Sovyet ordusunun ve Nova Projesinin başındaki karakter.. Hedefimizdeki düşman. Yine Mason tarafından infaz edilmiştir.

												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.Eat.

												I would say CoD BO I gives you the best single player Call of Duty experience. It has the best story of a CoD Game with a lot of thrilling, unexpected moments. The sound is decent. The controls are as common always just AAA-Class title. And the graphic is still great comparing it to new games from 2013/14. And for all 3D vision gamer out there, the support is native excellent and not only that they say it, it really is, I didn't experienced any shader/ ghosting problem at all. Respect for this support! The MP seems to be really popular either, considering that the servers are still full of players. Even if you think that you don't like CoD (because you believe the ♥♥♥♥♥torm without playing yourself), just give this game a try and I'll be sure, you are going to have an absolutely AAA-gaming experience. 8,5/10 and the game deserves it!!!

content:
Posted: March 10, 2015
												**77.8 Hours as of this review**          To be honest, I find it rather difficult to + or - this game for it has major ups and downs. The Multiplayer appears sustained at the moment as there is a server browser. I found the Single Player campaign to be interesting. But Zombies, the selling point (to me) is undernourished as the player base even reaches flatline 0 at times, but with friends it has the ability to prove very fun. The game is obviously not worth its current price of $39.99 and should be a $19.99 as it is aged and slightly underoptimized. The DLC, I feel is overpriced as well ($14.99) but Treyarch will be Treyarch and Activision will be Activision, to my dissapointment.EDIT: There is a server browser as previously stated, yes. However, the Multiplayer GAMEPLAY is significantly unoptimized. The slightest of detail costs 10 frames, its inhumane that dudes with Bachelor Degrees failed do stablize this after 4 years. I'll give them pity points at the very least.

												This game wasn't all bad. In fact, it was a nice change of pace in comparison to the games I usually play. Singleplayer and multiplayer were both pretty exciting while they lasted. "While they lasted"; that is the biggest problem I'm having with this franchise. After experiencing the singleplayer campaign, I don't feel like I'd like to go through it again, and the multiplayer experience only lasted one year until they've released a new game - now the servers are dead. I believe this game is just far too much for something that lasts only a year. I even see the newer games that cost over $100. This is my first and last time I'll ever purchase from this franchise.

content:
Posted: May 7, 2015
												First of all, I have to say that I haven't played either the campaign or the multiplayer, because I only bought this game for the "zombies part". So, here I go.I'm not enjoying this game. Why? Because I find it extremely difficult. I don't want to have a master in this game; I just want to relax and have fun, but I can't: zombies are very fast; yes, they are annoying so soon: in wave 3 they already start running. WTF?! I don't want to be stressed playing a game! And don't tell me I don't know how to play, because if knowing how to play implies going in circles or doing eights to get all the zombies together, wave after wave, I don't want to know how to play this game. Is that strategy? Really?I'm not saying either that the zombies should be slow. I'm just annoyed I cannot choose how challenging I want this game to be. Haven't the developers heard about something called "difficulty level"? Well, a lot of games let you choose from easy to increasing difficulty levels. Is this something that couldn't be added in this game? Really?Besides, why does it always have to be an endless horde mode? Why can't the game end with something different from dying? Why not missions that could end with you escaping alive? Spec. ops. in Modern Warfare 3 is a good example: you can play a mission which has a starting point and a finish point, of you can play survival: YOU CAN CHOOSE.By the way, why have you ripped some fantastic features COD World at War had? I'm talking about custom maps, cooperative campaign, LAN support and the PPSh among other fabulous weapons. Do you know how fun and polished some WAW fan-made maps are? Do you know that thanks to that customization the community has been able to correct some flaws the game has, like no FOV slider, which cannot be corrected in Black Ops?What does Black Ops' zombies do better than World at War? Slightly improved graphics, original maps plus some more (dlc's), most of them well designed, more perks and some new ideas (like the easter eggs).Apart from the things I've said I don't like of this game, it is still very expensive.

number of helpful: 5 of 11 people (45%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 16, 2015
IntroductionAs a fan of the CoD, mostly because of Modern Warfare, i couldnt skip the new series.Story(No Spoilers)The main character is Alex Mason, a CIA operative during the cold war, and the story centers on his participation in black ops, in an attempt to uncover a Communist plot to destroy the west. Game TimeIt takes about 8-12 hours to complete.In detailProbably the most interesting single player campaign in a CoD game so far. However, Multiplayer and the Zombies didnt fulfil my expectation (i'll explain later)Pros+ Great storyline in a very interesting era+ More atmospheric than any other CoD entry so far+ Great voice acting, and nice cutscenes.+ New timeframe, new weapons!+ Zombie Mode Cons- Graphics not satisfying enough, not to mention the fact that some specific settings cause glitches.- Worst multiplayer in a CoD series, from my point of view. A complete failure. Everything is poorly designed, the maps, the weapons-attachments, the killstreaks. It hasn't been a nice experience.Neutral*The zombies are fun and Treyarch did a great job implementing this mode into this new series. However, its predecessor was way better.Concluding, it's not a bad game overall, but since i was completely satisfied by the 1/3 of the game i cant recommend it.5/101. Dont touch it even if it's on the house [0-3 / 10]. 2. If you are bored of every other game [3-5 / 10]. 3. Grab it whenever it's on sale (or pay the full price if you are wealthy enough) [6-8] 4. Must Have [9-10 / 10]

												This was my first CoD game, and I don't think I'll be buying another.Pros: Zombies is pretty fun and had some decent comedy to it.Tomahawks, using these in multiplayer with scavanger was a cause of alot of my deaths because I'd try to use one against someone who was more wisely choosing to use bullets, still they're hillarious to use and you feel great after you manage to nail someone with it. Makes for a good final kill cam sometimes.Cons:Singleplayer story is pretty stupid.Multiplayer, nuketown... maybe I started playing pretty late in the game but I was playing before the next CoD game came out, still, almost every match was on the same map, it's small and chaotic which is fun but the same map repeatedly is bound to get old.Killstreaks, this is more a complaint with the series itself, I guess, but I don't understand how it makes sense to give someone who's already doing good enough to kill 10-20 people without dying a gunship that allows him to mow down everyone on the map, I started bringing anti air as my secondary just to stop the constant helicopter assualts and apparently that's not good form or something because people were hating on me for it.I played a free weekend of black ops 2 multiplayer and honestly it's the same game in my opinion. It seems a thing with shooters now to take the last game, change the guns a bit, add/remove various maps, change the name and resell it. Additionally, the constant releases of new games in the series means that if there's a newer game out buying an older one is pretty much pointless, most of the community will have moved on so multiplayer becomes more limited so you end up with 90% 24/7 Nuketown servers.
