number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 29, 2015
												IGN: 8.5/10GameSpot: 9/10Metacritic: 4.5/5This is why I have trust issues and that is why I never trust reviews and I make my own opinion of the game instead.How can people be such sheeps.After 5 years, the game is still 43.99 CAD.The game was and will always be ****.How can people like this piece of junk? Sorry not sorry but seriously, how?There are great games such as Half-Life, S.W.A.T., Rainbow Six, Ghost Recon, Star Wars Jedi Knight, Doom, Quake, Unreal Tournament, Battlefield 1942, Battlefield 2, etc etc... Just in the FPS category, I could say at least a hundred of games that are better than this piece of trash and the others that follows it so let's not talk about every other games that exist on this planet.No recoil, hitmarker, wallhack intensities (the stupid "tactical" aimpoint/scope), hackers, ****ty multiplayer, ****ty community, ****ty campaign, everything in this game is bad! The campaign just doesn't make sense at all and I paid to play a game not to watch the same cinematics everytimes, even LEGO games has more replay ability than this.What's wrong with people? Do you guys get money to give them a good review? I hope so because Activision, Treyarch and Infinity Ward should just quit, Call of Duty was great, Call of Duty 2 was great, Call of Duty 3 seems nice, Call of Duty 4 was okay, Call of Duty 5 World At War was okay, Call of Duty 6 was okay, Call of duty 7 (this one) is a pure joke, Call of Duty 8 (Modern Warfare 3), do I even need to talk about this one? Call of Duty 9 (Black Ops 2), they did it, they made their ****ty game even worse than before, well the good thing is that It can't be worse anymore then Call of Duty 10 (Ghosts) was released, they did it, they made it even worse, Black Ops deserves 1/10, Black Ops 2 and Ghosts being worse in every aspects, It's impossible to give this game a positive or even neutral review which means something like that -5/10, let's not forget about Call of Duty Advanced Warfare who came out not long ago, I don't even want to download a demo or even the full game on any sites just to try it a minute, It would be a waste of bandwidth and a waste of time.You guys can hate on my review but it doesn't matters in the end, this game is utterly trash that you like it or not.They release the same game every year but by making them even worse, It's like making a nice game then rereleasing the next year but by removing the nice stuff (health pickups instead of regeneration for example) and changing some stuff for the worse (weapons, maps, pretty much everything).I could say a lot more but I'll stop it here, sorry If i offend any of you with some words but this game is pure trash, I just can't believe kids and people pay full price for those games, I wouldn't even want it for free, I hate myself for having bought this trash.As an hardcore gamer, I'd prefer to go outside play sports and do stuff that normal people do instead of playing this trash but since I have the choice, I'll just stick to the good games that are worth playing and workout to stay in shape.1/10Don't like my review? I don't care, facts are facts after all, I couldn't care less.If you like the game, that's good for you, I hope that you're having fun on this overpriced piece of junk.The only way of having fun on this piece of junk is to play with friends or even your girlfriend but even so, I'd prefer to play games for mans than a game that was made for the 10 years old kids new at video games.If you compare an orange with an apple, it's just a question of personal taste right?But then if you compare a sh** to 5 dollars.Well, it should be logic to say that the 5 dollars is worth more than the sh**.In this case, Black Ops is the sh** but people still pay for it and way too much, I paid less than 30$ and I feel cheated as heck.Even if they would have gave me this game for free, I would still have feel cheated.Honest review, honest facts, if you can't stand it then uninstall Steam and never get on Internet again.I must admit that, even though the game is utterly bad, having bots is a great addition to the game, unlike EA who decided to downgrade their new games by not adding the bots again instead of making them better.

Blops1 has a server list which means you can pick which servers you go on, meaning there is alot less posibility of lag if because you can pick what Region you go on!Multiplayer: 7.5/10Overall the Zombies is the star of this game! I hope you enjoy!Full Game: 8.25/10

content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
TL;DR @ the bottom!About the Singleplayer campaign I have not much to say: It's been fun and violent and gory and all. Sound and Music design is also good. Graphics are pretty sweet and beautiful. I played the map 'Array', and loved how the sky and terrain looked. Storyline is also good. I enjoyed this Call of Duty for some degree but the most fun I have in Black Ops is in Multiplayer.Love Second Chance Pro!Sadly the mutliplayer is almost dead and the servers aren't so many. And some servers are hosted by dikcs, which will auto-kick any player using Second Chance, Chopper gunner and stuff, that the admins do not like.Earlier I was playing Black Ops on the console of my cousin, when I wasn't able to get Black Ops for PC for shi† reasons. I played well on the PS3. When I (years after) finally got Black Ops  on Steam and played the PC version multiplayer, I experienced how my skills got ported from console (boooh!) to PC. What's missing? The claim, that I hack. And probably your hate and jelly-being /trololoZombies? Many like them. I don't. It's not my zombie-playstyle if the zombies are chewing bullets like lunch. I prefer L4D2 or Killing Floor for mass-slaughter. Just my opinion!TL;DRIt's Call of Duty. Need I say more ;) ?

content:
Posted: September 8, 2016
												This was the last good Call of Duty.I have such a raging hard on for secret Cold War♥♥♥♥♥♥and this game brought it. The numbers brainwashing, good ol' Reznov's sneaky tricks. Dragovich, Kravchenko and Steiner were cool antagonists. Mason - Woods - Hudson are more memorable to me than the Soap - Price - Gaz/Ghost team.MW2 and BO had great multiplayers if you had a lot of friends to play with MW3 was trash. Since I've played BO2 and have no intention on buying it: BO2 would of been great if it was just 1980's Cold War missions. Multiplayer was boring.Story was real cool and the intel actually unlocked cool background information♥♥♥♥♥♥ This game had twice the depth as any CoD out there.Cod4, WaW, MW2, and BO1 are the best hands down other than the first CoD.Long live Reznov.

												So lets start this off. I bought this way back in 2010 for Xbox 360. Got close to max prestige and beat the campaign on Normal and Veteran difficulty. Now some people would wonder why you would buy this game again 3 years later. Well I honestly it is for the Zombies. Treyarch really hit it big in that department. If your looking for something to play with friends stick to the zombies and you will have a blast.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												2015-04-25 - Someone has wisely chosen to split the campaign game review from criticism of the multi-player game.  They are certainly two completely different games.There is a potentially interesting story here if the decision was made to focus on scripted drama instead of video gameplay, where choice and free-will are the implied drivers of the narrative.  Instead, we are spoonfed gameplay on rails where if you do not follow the lead of the puppeteer, you are, more-or-less, destined to failure and repeating the same scene over and over until you "get it right".  This, of course, shatters the immersion and turns an entertaining romp killing "bad guys" into a chore as you try to figure out the appropriate stimulus required for the response to move forward.If you are expected to follow a script and did not receive it before the curtains were drawn...well, that is not a recipe for success.The older I get, the more precious my time is.  I have not stopped playing a game for any other reason than lack of focus before I came upon this game.  To be fair, this realization was a cumulative understanding of the series, but the fact remains: this is the first game I uninstalled from my computer with no intention of ever completing that also actually incentivized me from uninstalling the sequel without even playing it.  Tar and feather me if I ever play another Call of Duty game again.If you enjoy the growing trend in single player action gaming where player reaction is defined more by responses and key presses irrelevant to the normal mechanics of the game, then you will be at home with Call of Duty: Black Ops.  Otherwise, I would recommend you avoid the game as any interesting narrative is likely to be lost behind the repetition of getting the dance steps right.

Posted: January 31, 2016
												this game is just the same as every other CoD so here is a recept for apple pie :D enjoy,Pastry2 cups all-purpose flour 1 teaspoon salt 2/3 cup plus 2 tablespoons shortening 4 to 6 tablespoons cold water Filling1/3 to 1/2 cup sugar 1/4 cup all-purpose flour 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg 1/8 teaspoon salt 8 cups thinly sliced peeled tart apples (8 medium) 2 tablespoons butter or margarine 1) In medium bowl, mix 2 cups flour and 1 teaspoon salt. Cut in shortening, using pastry blender (or pulling 2 table knives through ingredients in opposite directions), until particles are size of small peas. Sprinkle with cold water, 1 tablespoon at a time, tossing with fork until all flour is moistened and pastry almost cleans side of bowl (1 to 2 teaspoons more water can be added if necessary).2) Gather pastry into a ball. Divide in half; shape into 2 flattened rounds on lightly floured surface. Wrap in plastic wrap; refrigerate about 45 minutes or until dough is firm and cold, yet pliable. This allows the shortening to become slightly firm, which helps make the baked pastry more flaky. If refrigerated longer, let pastry soften slightly before rolling.3) Heat oven to 425°F. With floured rolling pin, roll one pastry round into round 2 inches larger than upside-down 9-inch glass pie plate. Fold pastry into fourths; place in pie plate. Unfold and ease into plate, pressing firmly against bottom and side.4) In large bowl, mix sugar, 1/4 cup flour, the cinnamon, nutmeg and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Stir in apples until well mixed. Spoon into pastry-lined pie plate. Cut butter into small pieces; sprinkle over filling. Trim overhanging edge of pastry 1/2 inch from rim of plate.5) Roll other round of pastry into 10-inch round. Fold into fourths and cut slits so steam can escape. Unfold top pastry over filling; trim overhanging edge 1 inch from rim of plate. Fold and roll top edge under lower edge, pressing on rim to seal; flute as desired. Cover edge with 2- to 3-inch strip of foil to prevent excessive browning.6) Bake 40 to 50 minutes or until crust is brown and juice begins to bubble through slits in crust, removing foil for last 15 minutes of baking. Serve warm if desired.

Posted: January 7, 2016
												One of Treyarch's biggest hit in my opinion. Campaign becomes memorable as you meet more characrters. The story-line of the game cooralates with Treyarch's previous game COD : World At War. What I like most about Call of Duty Black Ops is stepping it up with intense zombies. All the Zombie maps are memorable and nostalgic. The rush you get while playing Zombies. THE BEST. And who can't forget multiplayer. I really enjoyed multiplayer but not as much as zombies.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
												Gameplay 3.5/5Soundtrack 3/5Multiplayer 4/5Characters 5/5Zombie survival 4/5An overall great game. I recommend getting this. Even if you are not into First person shooter games, this is a great start. The single-player is great. It has strong characters and memorable moments. It is set during the cold war and involves an american (alex mason) being interrogated about "the numbers" and a russian named "Dragovich" who is working with the cubans. The multiplayer is great with balanced weapons, A great set of maps and no sweaty 5 year olds being *****. Unfortunatly people only play the map "Nuketown". The other maps are good aswell and there is a large variety, and even more in DLC! The best maps are Cracked, Nuketown, Launch and Jungle. The zombies mode has 3 maps. The first one is "kino Der Toten" (german for theater of the dead) which has our 4 main characters (tank dempsey, nikolai belinski, takeo masaki and edward richtofen) fighting zombies after they arrived there from Der Riese (in COD world at war) The second map is called "Five". Zombies broke into the pentagon and the 4 characters ( JFK, Fidel castro, Richard nixon and some other guy) have to survive as long as they can. The third map is a suprise (Im not gonna tell you). I highly recommend you get DLC for zombies, Especially the Ressurection DLC because that is all Zombie maps.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												2015-04-25 - Someone has wisely chosen to split the campaign game review from criticism of the multi-player game.  They are certainly two completely different games.There is a potentially interesting story here if the decision was made to focus on scripted drama instead of video gameplay, where choice and free-will are the implied drivers of the narrative.  Instead, we are spoonfed gameplay on rails where if you do not follow the lead of the puppeteer, you are, more-or-less, destined to failure and repeating the same scene over and over until you "get it right".  This, of course, shatters the immersion and turns an entertaining romp killing "bad guys" into a chore as you try to figure out the appropriate stimulus required for the response to move forward.If you are expected to follow a script and did not receive it before the curtains were drawn...well, that is not a recipe for success.The older I get, the more precious my time is.  I have not stopped playing a game for any other reason than lack of focus before I came upon this game.  To be fair, this realization was a cumulative understanding of the series, but the fact remains: this is the first game I uninstalled from my computer with no intention of ever completing that also actually incentivized me from uninstalling the sequel without even playing it.  Tar and feather me if I ever play another Call of Duty game again.If you enjoy the growing trend in single player action gaming where player reaction is defined more by responses and key presses irrelevant to the normal mechanics of the game, then you will be at home with Call of Duty: Black Ops.  Otherwise, I would recommend you avoid the game as any interesting narrative is likely to be lost behind the repetition of getting the dance steps right.

content:
Posted: June 16, 2015
												Having played it on the Xbox 360 for a large amount of time (1000+ hours overall), I would recommend this game to fans of the series as well as someone who is inexperienced with FPS games. Like most games in the CoD series, the game is fairly self explanatory on how to play. The depth however that arises in the balancing of weapons is far greater than most players would think however. Quick Scoping is viable but difficult to perform in comparison to other games, and the assault rifles are fairly balanced for their ranges. While some guns are obviously better than others, it's entirely possible to have fun with every one of them due to the variety in attachments and class system that Black Ops provides. The zombies mode in this game is definitely the best one out of the CoD series since 2015. The sheer amount of content that Treyarch puts into these zombie maps should be a good enough reason to buy them. I remember spending hours and hours doing the easter eggs in order to uncover the plot and bonuses that each zombie map had. Learning the strategies for surviving based on the amount of players you have is also a great experience. The DLC maps provide new zombie maps (as well as some multiplayer maps) that contain new perks, guns/gadgets, easter eggs, and value from the time you will spend playing them.

												Now, this game runs terrible on my PC so I am not reviewing my experience on the PC, but on the Xbox 360. The campaign is one of my favourite Call of Duty Campaigns, other than Modern Warfare 2. The multiplayer is fun to play and the ability to buy the attachments you want for a gun instead of grinding the hell out of it makes the game more enjoyable in some aspects. The vanilla zombies is my favourite Call of Duty Zombies, that I have played, but if it were the zombie mode in general, I pick WAW zombies on the PC because of the endless amount of mods. This is a great Call of Duty. If you are spectacle about it, wait for it to go on sale because the $40 it costs now is a bit much for a 6 year old game.

content:
Posted: April 23
												Beat the game on Hardened in ~7 hours.  Didn't do any achievement hunting, and didn't notice any collectible intelligence tapes until I was about 2/3rds through the game.  4 missions in, I very nearly stopped playing because I wasn't having any fun. I would only recommend this game 1) if it was a deep discount and 2)you really want to be a completionist for the Call of Duty series.The drop off from Infinity Ward to Treyarch is very apparent with this game.(I had just finished Modern Warfare 3 and immediately started playing Black Ops.)Treyarch simply isn't as good as Infinity Ward when it comes to this series.  Their writing and level design are ok, but if you put them into close comparison with IW (again, I literally finished MW3, uninstalled it, installed Black Ops, and started playing it) there are huge gaps.  AI is a great example - with IW, the AI serve to guide your character along, fill in plot points, and generally not get in the way of you having fun.  In Black Ops, the AI basically stands around and say the same 4 or 5 lines over and over (such as Enemy Down. That's a confirmed kill.  You're getting shot up, get to cover.)  What a waste of Ed Harris, Gary Oldman, Ice Cube, and Sam Worthington.AI is monumentally stupid as well - they are completely dependent on your character and will just stand around occasionally shooting until you get far enough ahead that they run up after.  Meanwhile, enemy AI will run right past them and kill you while your squad does nothing.  Enemy AI is almost singularly focused on you.  There was one level "Khe Sanh" where marines would be scripted to literally stand in a line at the top of a ridge even though there was a barrier 5 feet to the right.  If you stand near these marines, the enemy from all over the battlefield would take shots at only you, and when they charged right up the hill shooting at you, the marines would stand there.  This behavior was standard - enemies could frequently run right past your squad to melee or shoot you. Level objectives are often unclear - they don't appear on screen and what exactly you need to do isn't always told to you.  The Khe Sanh level is a good example.  You are being overrun by infinite enemies and there are two napalm barrels you need to puncture and knock over for some reason.  There is nothing to tell you that you need to do this (the AI mentiones they haven't been buried yet, but that's it), though sometimes the AI will yell "We need to improvise, Mason!".  There are no objective markers on the barrels, no "target" floating over them like other levels.  They aren't glowing, and shooting them does nothing (but apparently your knife will punch right through the steel).  You have to get right next to them before the prompt appears for interaction which has your character stab them with your knife and them kick them down the hill.Level design is sparse compared to the IW entries in the COD series.  Lots of small alcoves and staircases that end in closed doors which were purely there to give them a place to spawn enemies to pour out of, but also invisible barriers in tall grass and knee high rocks that you can't scale...hallmarks of level design that doesn't organically guide the player through the game.  In comparison to MW3 where you found that they filled levels with a lot more detail.  There, you can move through a burned out apartment building that actually looks like an apartment building.  Black Ops is very much an On Rails game.The game has many aspects that you'll find familiar in the COD series - controlling a gunship, riding and shooting in vehicles, regenerating health, invisible checkpoints you need to cross to get enemies to stop spawning, planting explosives, and so on.  Some weapons have different types of ammo you can switch between, or different firing modes.  For some reason, they have a crossbow as one of your military-issued weapons.  No idea why except maybe they thought it was cool?  Personally, I'd rather have a scoped dragunov.  You can't say the purpose is to have a silent distance weapon, since you are literally told to use the explosive bolts when you first get it.  Again, give me an M16 with an m203 "Thumper" under the barrel instead.The story of this game was interesting, but Treyarch was much more interested in the sci-fi delivery of it than actually telling it.  The premise is that you're being interrogated and are reliving all the missions as memories.  This is a jarring break when you're in the middle of evacuating a base in the middle of enemies and the screen goes to black and you hear the voiceover chime in "That's how you escaped, but what happened to...." and you find yourself pulled out of the action.  This is basically makes it a poor version of Assassin's Creed but without any attachment to the character.  The President literally tells you that are "The Best. Anywhere."  But I never felt like that in the game's story.  I was an idiot surrounded by bigger idiots.

content:
Posted: November 12, 2012
												Call of Duty®: Black Ops is a triumph in gaming innovation. From breath-taking grenade physics to stunning numbers, Black Ops has it all in spades.To call it a videogame is quite frankly an insult to the passionate developers at Infinity Ward for Black Ops is a financial investment into "fun". With a campaign and FOV that leaves you dizzy in all the right ways, Call of Duty®: Black Ops throws out the book on traditional first-person shooter mechanics to be later sold as DLC. 8.5/10. Nothing short of revolutionary.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2015
												Truly one of the last good CoD games. The time that it's set in is great, it's like the perfect mix between legacy military combat and technology. It's a shame that more wasn't done in this cold war era. The zombies was great too, maps like Ascension and Call of the Dead were some of my favorite maps in the whole of the Zombies timeline. They were simple, well designed and the gimmicks and Easter eggs they contained were in-depth and great!The multiplayer also had some quite abstract, but well executed ideas, I liked the currency system first of all, it was different and it gave you a reason to play other than just to level up, you could earn more money which could be spend on new calling cards and attachments for weapons or even just new weapons themselves. Also, if you wanted to, you could try your luck in gambling, interesting game modes like “Gungame” and “One in the Chamber” were a great way to compete to win other people's money, I remember losing like 10,000 points on one of the high stakes modes and I was gutted, I actually cared about it, which is something I can't say for more recent Call of Duty titles, they lack innovation, I mean sure, you can call all of this future jetpack s*** innovation but really all it does is detract from the experience, the future is overdone and boring, I liked playing the campaigns in Call of Duty games because they took you to conflicts that happened in the past and created a story based around said conflicts, when you take things into the future all you do is make it generic and uninteresting. Who cares what happens in some futuristic fictional war that will never happen? I sure don't.In summary, I like Call of Duty: Black Ops because of its use of recent history, you get to see places like Vietnam during the war and I think that's real swell. Also most of the multiplayer maps were based around areas that had seen conflict during the past at some point, which gave it a good historical feeling. I do think that this is the last game so far in the CoD series to do this (I've played every one apart from Ghosts), and I just wish that the devs at Treyarch and IW would take my criticisms into consideration, I know they won't, but it would be really nice to see a return to the basics next time it's CoD season.I'd give this game a 8/10, not that my rating carries any weight or anything, I mean I'm just your standard game player (I'd say gamer but as of late the connotations of the word in the realms of pop culture make me cringe too much to consider myself as a gamer.)Side note: I'm talking mostly from my experiences on the Xbox 360 version of this game, just a heads up in-case there's any inconsistencies in this review. Give us a rate if you enjoyed my insight or whatever.
